code:
def unique_elements_from_lists(list1, list2):
    # This function takes two lists and returns a set of unique elements from both lists
    return set(list1).union(set(list2))

def common_elements_from_lists(list1, list2):
    # This function takes two lists and returns a set of common elements from both lists
    return set(list1).intersection(list2)

# Example usage of the functions
list_a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
list_b = [4, 5, 6, 7, 8]

# Get unique elements from both lists
unique_elements = unique_elements_from_lists(list_a, list_b)
print("Unique elements from both lists:", unique_elements)

# Get common elements from both lists
common_elements = common_elements_from_lists(list_a, list_b)
print("Common elements from both lists:", common_elements)

# Intentional Error: The following function is supposed to calculate the symmetric difference of two sets
def symmetric_difference(list1, list2):
    # Returns the symmetric difference of two sets (elements present in either set, but not both)
    return set(list1).symmetric_difference(list2)

# Attempt to calculate the symmetric difference using lists instead of sets
sym_diff = symmetric_difference(list_a, list_b)
print("Symmetric difference of both lists:", sym_diff)
